DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name of anatomic sites that have evidence of prostate cancer involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.  -- 2002_To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (RET-row-PAIR-ih-toe-NEE-ul) Having to do with the area outside or behind the peritoneum (the tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen).: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in, or located in the retroperitoneum.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Two cup shaped areas, one each on the lateral side of the lower pelvis that house the head of the femur to form the ball and socket joint of the hip.

Concepts.definition: Two cup shaped areas, one each on the lateral side of the lower pelvis that house the head of the femur to form the ball and socket joint of the hip.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The broad, dorsal, upper, and widest of the three principal bones composing either half of the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The broad, dorsal, upper, and widest of the three principal bones composing either half of the pelvis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The most posterior and ventral bone making up the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The most posterior and ventral bone making up the pelvis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The wedge-shaped bone consisting of five fused vertebrae, S1-S5 in man, forming the posterior part of the pelvis; its base connects with the lowest lumbar vertebra and its tip with the coccyx.

Concepts.definition: The triangular bone, made up of 5 fused bones of the spine, located in the lower area of the spine between the fifth lumbar vertebra and the coccyx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to or constituting vertebrae.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to or constituting vertebrae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A superficial or deep lymph node located in the inguinal area.

Concepts.definition: A superficial or deep lymph node located in the inguinal area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any lymph node within the pelvic region.

Concepts.definition: Any lymph node within the abdominal pelvic region.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the mediastinum. Mediastinal lymph nodes are arranged in three groups, one on the lateral, another on the medial, and a third on the anterior aspect of the vessels; the third group is, however, sometimes absent.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the mediastinum. Mediastinal lymph nodes are arranged in three groups, one on the lateral, another on the medial, and a third on the anterior aspect of the vessels; the third group is, however, sometimes absent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymph nodes located above the clavicle (collarbone).

Concepts.definition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymph nodes found in the armpit that drain the lymph channels from the breast.

Concepts.definition: Lymph nodes found in the armpit that drain the lymph channels from the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes located in the neck.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes located in the neck.
